author: Bill Reynolds
title: For Bryant assistant Chris Burns, nation's first openly gay college hoops coach, coming out was a decision years in making
text: For Bryant assistant Chris Burns, decision to come out was years in the making Comment Follow @breynolds401 Posted Oct. 8, 2015 at 2:38 PM Chris Burns, assistant men's basketball coach at Bryant University, has become the first openly gay head coach or assistant coach in Division I college basketball. On the day that Burns' story first appeared in USA Today, Burns discussed his decision to come out with The Journal's Bill Reynolds. He said he knew he was gay at age 13. But as an athlete in a small New Hampshire town, he was coming of age in a time when very few people talked about such issues, least of all athletes. "The people that have come before me, and the people that will come after me," Burns said. "That's why it's important. And I've waited 31 years for it." Check back later for Reynolds' full column on Burns.
